img.title: DCIM100MEDIADJI_0006.JPG
img.rs-layer: Salem City Schools will prepare all students in a safe and welcoming learning environment to be informed citizens who embrace life-long learning, and who are capable of taking their places as contributing members of society

h4.a: Important Salem High School Senior Updates

div.div: Important Dates for Salem High School Seniors (Follow @salemhscounselors on Instagram for updates and check your email daily) Although many of our typical senior activities will not take place, we want to make sure you mark your calendars for these important dates. Cap/Gown Curbside Pickup by gym doors: Monday, April 27th from 1:00- 3:00 pm Alumni Awards: Award winners will be notified May 1st…

Online kindergarten registration for the Salem City School District will begin on Monday, April 27, and will run through Sunday, May 3. Children need to be five years old by September 30, 2020, to be able to register for kindergarten for the 2020-2021 school year. Parents will need to take a few minutes to complete the first step in the kindergarten registration process by completing…

div.p: It is our goal that you find the Salem City Schools web site informative and easy to navigate. We welcome your comments and suggestions. Please contact Aaron Vogt at WebMaster@salem.k12.oh.us. Thank you for visiting the Salem City Schools web pages. In accordance with all federal, state, and local laws, the Salem City School District Board of Education does not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, national origin, age, religion, disability, or genetic origin. Salem City Schools’ Section 504 Coordinator is Kristy Erb, 1226 E State St, Salem, OH 44460, 330-332-0316. The Title IX Coordinator is Dr Joe Shivers, 1226 E State St, Salem, OH 44460, 330-332-0316.
